nodes.name: Acid Chozo Statue
nodes.note: This node represents the ledge the statue is on. This is why it can be reached without breaking the PB blocks, but not unlocked.

nodes.name: Acid Statue Room Junction (Above Acid Plug Without Acid)
nodes.note: Because going here while there is acid is pointless unless traveling from 1 to 3, this node will be considered to only be visitable when the acid is gone

strats.name: Reverse Acid Statue CF Grapple Clip
strats.note: The extra power bomb or morph bombs is to get through the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: Golden Torizo Room Right Door (to Screw Attack)

runways.name: Base Runway - Golden Torizo Room Right Door (to Screw Attack)

strats.name: Base
devNote: FIXME: Given a way around the door lock, this runway can be used coming in, or leaving, but not both due to activating GT.
Taking a hit from GT allows use of a small runway.
Safe spotting GT from the right lets you move him to the left wall without getting hit, for a nearly full runway.
Pushing GT left then taking a hit allows use of the full runway.

locks.name: Golden Torizo Room Grey Lock (to Screw Attack)

nodes.name: Missile (Golden Torizo)
Super Missile (Golden Torizo)
Golden Torizo

unlockStrats.name: Safe Spot Heatproof Supers
unlockStrats.note: Farm supers to use throughout the fight.
unlockStrats.devNote: Supers are farmable here, so no ammo requirement.

unlockStrats.name: Safe Spot Supers
note: This strat is assuming no farming. It requires 30 supers, but can be done with 29.
This requires a very steady fire rate so that for every Super Missile caught by GT, the next 4 Supers do damage.
devNote: No farming expected because that would change the heat frames.
Supers count hard-coded because of GT's inherent 'dodging' ability.
We could use an enemyKill if this were integrated into the enemy definition.
It actually takes 29 supers but giving 1 extra in leniency since it's easy to miss.

unlockStrats.name: Heatproof Supers
note: This is an estimate of the net damage taken, including farmed energy.
Supers are farmable here, so no ammo requirement.

unlockStrats.name: Supers
devNote: No farming expected because that would change the heat frames.
Supers count hard-coded because of GT's inherent 'dodging' ability.
We could use an enemyKill if this were integrated into the enemy definition.
It actually takes 29 supers but giving 1 extra in leniency since it's easy to miss

unlockStrats.name: Full Combo
unlockStrats.note: This is an estimate of the net damage taken, including farmed energy.

unlockStrats.name: Almost Full Combo
unlockStrats.note: This is an estimate of the net damage taken, including farmed energy.

unlockStrats.name: Charge Plasma
unlockStrats.note: This is an estimate of the net damage taken, including farmed energy.

unlockStrats.name: Full Spazer
unlockStrats.note: This is an estimate of the net damage taken, including farmed energy.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Golden Torizo Supers Double Shinespark
note: One vertical spark is needed to open up the breakable blocks on the right ceiling.
Then, a second horizontal spark is performed where those blocks were cleared to reveal the item.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Golden Torizo Safe Spot
note: The ability to get into the safe spot in the Golden Torizo fight, where Samus can attack while being safe from GT's standard attacks.
To get into the safe spot near the door: Stand on the left side of the floor pillar for GT to jump back. Then stand to the right of the nearby background pillar.

strats.name: GT Crumble Jump to Left Item
GT Direct Jump to Left Item
note: There's enough running room in the room for a precise jump to get directly across.
Needs to be flush against the door though, so takes a bit longer than the crumble jump.

strats.name: GT Bomb Boost to Left Item
strats.note: Uses a single bomb blast to just barely get propelled past the crumble pit.

strats.name: GT Crumble Jump from Left Item
strats.note: It takes a short hop to avoid hitting the ceiling to do this with only one crumble jump.

strats.name: GT Direct Jump from Left Item
note: There's not enough running room to get directly across.
But with a precise enough jump and short hop, it's possible to walljump off the far edge and avoid the crumble blocks.

strats.name: GT Bomb Boost from Left Item
strats.note: Uses a single bomb blast to just barely get propelled past the crumble pit.

strats.name: Speed HiJump Screw
strats.note: Build run speed for a jump straight into the destructible blocks.

strats.name: GT Supers Screw Walljump
strats.note: This is kind of tricky because Screw off a walljump can only break bomb blocks if you change directions before bonking.

strats.name: GT Supers Walljump Into Double Shinespark
note: One vertical spark is needed to open up the area directly above.
Then, a second horizontal spark is performed where those blocks were cleared.
Try to aim for the seam between tiles to break more blocks.  And the left side of the opening may be slightly easier.

strats.name: GT Supers Double Shinespark With HiJump
note: One vertical spark is needed to open up the area directly above.
A running jump is used to jump high enough into the revealed hole for a horizontal spark.

strats.name: GT Supers IBJ
strats.note: Expects two IBJs; one to break a block, then another one to get back up.
strats.devNote: Needs strats for variations of IBJs, mainly for heatframe count.

strats.name: Instant Morph Bomb Placement.
note: Walljump up to reach the left ledge below the bomb blocks then perform an instant morph to place a bomb.
Walljump up a second time and again instant morph off that left ledge to enter the 1 tile hole created by the bomb.

strats.name: GT Supers Morph Bomb Springwall
note: Uses a Springwall to put a bomb on the left corner bomb block, then a second one to get in there.
Then clears the rest of the bomb blocks normally.
It winds up costing less heat frames than IBJ, if you fall.

nodes.name: Screw Attack Left Door (to Golden Torizo)

runways.name: Base Runway - Screw Attack Left Door (to Golden Torizo)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

runways.name: Base Runway - Screw Attack Bottom Right Door (to Recharge)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

nodes.name: Screw Attack Top Right Door (to Fast Rippers)

runways.name: Base Runway - Screw Attack Top Right Door (to Fast Rippers)
Runway with Intact Blocks - Screw Attack Top Right Door (to Fast Rippers)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This longer runway is not usable if the bomb blocks are destroyed.

devNote: Reaching blue in the middle of the runway will fall through the bomb blocks, and that may not be ideal.
FIXME: There is a small section on the far left that could be used as runway coming in.
And some strats are ok with gaining blue on top of the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: Screw Attack
Screw Attack Junction (Above Bottom Blocks with Top Blocks Broken)
nodes.note: This exists because many strats for going up are somehwat independant from the strat for breaking the bomb blocks.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape
note: Store a shinespark and break the Screw Attack Room bomb blocks from above in order to collect the item and shinespark out.
Screw Attack is easier to excute but has fewer shinespark frames to work with.
A SpeedKeep is difficult to initiate but moves through the room quickly.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Left-Side X-Ray Climb (to Middle Door)
strats.note: Heat frames split into the actual climb and the setup in the adjacent room.

to.note: Shinespark and XRayClimb have a direct link. Other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Left-Side X-Ray Climb (to Top Door)
strats.note: Heat frames split into the actual climb and the setup in the adjacent room.

to.note: Shinespark and XRayClimb have a direct link. Other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2 -> 3.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Transition Screwjump
strats.note: Run through the doorway with enough momentum to break the bomb blocks with Screw.

strats.name: Jump into Room Shinespark
note: Jump into Screw Attack Room and spark diagonally once above the center of the door vertically.
Or diagonally spark anywhere that is not the bottom of the door in the previous room.
strats.devNote: TODO: Sparking diagonally through the door cannot be shown as an alternative.

strats.name: Screw Attack Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Heat frames split into the actual climb and the setup in the adjacent room.

strats.name: SpeedKeep
strats.note: This expects the more controlled speedkeep to fall though the blocks, not storing a shinecharge through the door.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room SpeedKeep Descent and Shinespark Escape Middle Door Part 1
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape
strats.note: Store the shinecharge while hitting the door transition to keep the ability to break blocks.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Screw Descent and Shinespark Escape Middle Door Part 1
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape

strats.name: Screw Attack Room IBJ to Break the Top Blocks
strats.note: Expects that you fall down afterwards.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Springwall Morph Bombs
strats.note: Use a Springwall to get up to the bomb blocks, to break them with a morph bomb.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Transition Speedjump (Morph Bombs)
strats.note: Run in the adjacent room and jump through the door, to place a Morph Bomb to break the obstacle.

to.note: The heat frames for these strats assumes you've already fallen from the door, because the cost is already baked into the subsequent 5-> 3 heat costs when relevant.

strats.name: SpeedBooster
devNote: TODO: Running in is not required.  Entering the room with canBlueSpaceJump could work, for example.

strats.name: SpeedKeep
strats.note: This expects the more controlled speedkeep to fall though the blocks, not storing a shinecharge on the first breakable block.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room SpeedKeep Descent and Shinespark Escape Top Door Part 1
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape
strats.note: Simultaneously store a shinespark and break through the bomb blocks down to the Screw Attack item location.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Screw Descent and Shinespark Escape Top Door Part 1
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape
strats.note: Store a shinespark then use screw to break through the bomb blocks down to the Screw Attack item location.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Shinespark Escape Mid Door Part 2
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape
strats.note: Diagonally shinespark towards the middle door.
devNote: There is no actual runway. Obstacle C is indicating that Samus has a shinecharge ready to be used.
Useful only if you cannot reach the door at 2.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Shinespark Escape Top Door Part 2
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Screw Attack Room Descent and Shinespark Escape
strats.note: Carry a shinecharge down though the bomb blocks and shinespark back up.
strats.devNote: There is no actual runway. Obstacle C is indicating that Samus has a shinecharge ready to be used.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Doorway Speedjump
strats.note: Position yourself in the door way, then run and jump. Makes it possible to walljump up.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Doorway CWJ
strats.note: Position yourself in the door way a few pixels from the edge.  Dashing stationary spinjump into a delayed CWJ and hopefully catch the upper ledge with a walljump.

to.note: Some of these strats expect that you to start from the platform below the door, while others are from the doorsill.
to.devNote: Because getting to this node always requires breaking A, the strats here don't bother re-checking whether it's broken

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This longer runway requires the green gate to be open, and usually involves tanking some ripper hits.

nodes.name: Fast Rippers Junction (Left of Green Gate)

strats.name: Kill some Rippers
strats.note: The time lost by setting up a few strategic kills is pretty much offset by not having damage recoil.

strats.name: Kill some Rippers
strats.note: It's more chaotic because the GGG's unreliability makes the room more variable, but one PB or 2 Super kills should usually do it.
